intro: Ceropegia montagnacii, commonly known as the mountain ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant produces small, pale yellow or greenish-white flowers that are often fragrant. Ceropegia montagnacii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to indoor conditions.
